description: Variation of condition 3 (in accordance with approved drawings) pursuant to planning permission dated 22/09/2016 ref 2016/3999 (Alterations including excavation to enlarge basement including formation of front lightwell; erection of two-storey extension and single storey rear extension in connection with conversion of property from a house into 1 x 1 bedroom, 1 x 2 bedroom and 1 x 3 bedroom flats) to allow glazed door with safety railing to first floor rear elevation and retention of raised parapet above ground floor rear extension.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of the initial planning permission ref: 2016/3999
 (dated: 22/09/2016).
To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.

Condition : 2 - The external materials to be used in the approved development shall match
those of the existing building.
In the interest of the appearance of the development, in accordance with
Council policy DMS1.

Condition : 3 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed [8575 02 rev D, 8575 50]. 
To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.

Condition : 4 - The roofs of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony,
roof garden, sitting out area or for any purpose of a similar nature without the
prior written consent of the local planning authority.
To protect the privacy of neighbours and prevent overlooking, in accordance with Council policy DMS1.

Condition : 5 - Details of arrangements for the storage of refuse and cycle parking shall be
submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before the
development commences. The works shall be carried out as approved before the permitted occupation starts.
In the interests of amenity, hygiene and sustainable transport, in accordance
with Council policies DMS1 and DMT2.

Condition : 6 - Prior to the commencement of development details of proposed front lightwell
treatment, including the means of enclosure and front elevation comprising
fenestration details and materials, shall be submitted to and approved by the
local planning authority. Such details as may be approved shall be carried out prior to occupation of the building.
To ensure a satisfactory appearance and to accord with Council policy DMS1 and the guidance in the Housing SPD, 2015.

Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application.  The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning Documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.

Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE: As the site is adjacent to Network Rail's operational railway
infrastructure, Network Rail strongly recommends the developer contacts
AssetProtectionAnglia@networkrail.co.uk prior to any works commencing on
site, specifically with regards to future maintenance, drainage, scaffolding,
piling and fencing. Network Rail strongly recommends the developer agrees an Asset Protection Agreement with us to enable approval of detailed works.
More information can also be obtained from the Network Rail website at
www.networkrail.co.uk/aspx/1538.aspx. The Applicant is also advised that the full details of the comments provided by Network Rail can be accessed from the Council website at www.wandsworth.gov.uk.

Condition : 9 - INFORMATIVE - Common Frog: This property is in an area known to support
the common frog (Rana temporaria) which are undergoing rapid population
decline. We recommend that any construction / scaffolding works that involve disturbance to or loss of wetlands including damp areas within private gardens should be undertaken in autumn only, to prevent disruption to over wintering and breeding populations. Further advice on this can be gained from the council's Biodiversity advisor by emailing biodiversity@enablelc.org or by phoning 020 3959 0060.

Condition : 10 - INFORMATIVE - House Sparrow: This property is in an area known to host
House sparrow (Passer domesticus) a species undergoing severe population
decline. Nests are often placed in holes and crevices within buildings and as
such they are vulnerable to construction and development work inadvertently destroying nests and nest sites We recommend that any works including any preparatory work and / or scaffolding is undertaken outside the nesting season (Feb- August) to prevent breaches of the law with regard to nesting birds. We would also encourage the applicant to include provision for nest spaces within the redevelopment - further advice on this can be gained from the council's Biodiversity advisor by emailing biodiversity@enablelc.org or by phoning 020 3959 0060.

Condition : 11 - INFORMATIVE - Stag Beetles: There is evidence that stag beetles (Lucanus
cervus) are in the vicinity of the site. Stag beetles spend much of their life cycle in larvae form occupying dead wood. The proposed works (or activity
associated with their implementation) may do harm stag beetles or their
habitat. Given the evidence of stag beetles in the area it would also be prudent to create potential new habitats for stag beetles. Further information, on this can be gained from the council's Biodiversity specialists by emailing
biodiversity@enablelc.org or by phoning 020 3959 0060. Whilst bats
are also recorded from the vicinity, the proposed works should not have any
impact upon potential roost spaces.

Condition : 12 - INFORMATIVE - Swifts: This property is in an area known to host swifts (Apus apus) a species undergoing population decline. Nests are often placed under the eaves of buildings and as such they are vulnerable to construction and development work inadvertently destroying nests and nest sites. We
recommend that any works including preparatory work, demolition, scaffolding and new constructions are undertaken outside the nesting season (Feb - August) to prevent breaches of the law with regard to nesting birds. We would also encourage the applicant to include provision for nest spaces within the redevelopment - further advice on this can be gained from the council's Biodiversity advisor by emailing biodiversity@enablelc.org or by phoning 020 3959 0060.

Condition : 13 - INFORMATIVE: The adjoining Railway lineside around Streatham Junction
Site of Borough Importance for Nature Conservation may not in any way be
used for the purpose of effecting the works, including (but not limited to)
access and storage of materials / waste and / or positioning of scaffolding or
welfare units at any time for any purpose.
Reason: to ensure that no damage occurs to the site nor that there is any loss of quality or condition of the biodiversity value of the site.
